description:
Angola has implemented a national health fence from 27 March to 11 Apri (or duration of State of Emergency), with entry and exit from national territory prohibited for all. Exception is given for entry and exit of essential goods and services, humanitarian aid, entry and exit of patients. 
Persons under these exceptions are subject to the mandatory test.

Angola states that formal and informal markets are only allowed to sell food, natural products, hygiene and beauty related products, and cooking gas during the state of emergency after March 27. Door-to-door selling done by zungueiras will be allowed. Street markets which imply mass gathering are to be closed. With the exception of banks and payment services, telecommunications, press, radios, televisions, and establishments selling food, all private commercial establishments are to be closed. Restaurants providing take-away or delivery services are allowed. Gas stations and establishments providing maintenance for vehicles will remain open, as will mortuary agencies.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
